textContent:
Unsettled 
Resentful
Frustrated
Annoyed 
Trapped 

Accused of being upset, distant, gropey, busy, inconsiderate, selfish

Not understood. Like I have to check my true self. I want to care for, help, teach, play, dream, nurture, cook. And I want to know it is enjoyed, connecting, wanted. I'm willing to put in the effort, focus, energy, time. But eventually, when there is no clear connection, proof of enjoyment, or reinforcement I grow tired, frustrated and sad. Then I withdraw into myself, often with confusion.

I am not looking for validation. I am not doing the things out of selfishness where I only do them because I want to be told how great I am. But I do want to know if what I do is actually making your life better or worse. I want to known that my touch is enjoyed, advice is wanted and helpful, and that the energy and effort is actually making a difference. 

When there is no feedback or negative feedback, it will cause me to change my approach or stop all together. It's easy to do this with friends and colleagues. I will stop spending time with them, or engage in a transactional way. 

When there is positive feedback loop 

I wonder why I am not good at deepening and maintaining friendships? Because I'm not good at letting people help me? Because I am not good at saying what I'm feeling? Because it's easier for me to ask then it is for me to reveal? Because it's easier for me to project than it is for me to own?
title: Relationship reflections
textContentHtml:
Unsettled 

Resentful

Frustrated

Annoyed 

Trapped 


Accused of being upset, distant, gropey, busy, inconsiderate, selfish


Not understood. Like I have to check my true self. I want to care for, help, teach, play, dream, nurture, cook. And I want to know it is enjoyed, connecting, wanted. I'm willing to put in the effort, focus, energy, time. But eventually, when there is no clear connection, proof of enjoyment, or reinforcement I grow tired, frustrated and sad. Then I withdraw into myself, often with confusion.


I am not looking for validation. I am not doing the things out of selfishness where I only do them because I want to be told how great I am. But I do want to know if what I do is actually making your life better or worse. I want to known that my touch is enjoyed, advice is wanted and helpful, and that the energy and effort is actually making a difference. 


When there is no feedback or negative feedback, it will cause me to change my approach or stop all together. It's easy to do this with friends and colleagues. I will stop spending time with them, or engage in a transactional way. 


When there is positive feedback loop 


I wonder why I am not good at deepening and maintaining friendships? Because I'm not good at letting people help me? Because I am not good at saying what I'm feeling? Because it's easier for me to ask then it is for me to reveal? Because it's easier for me to project than it is for me to own?
